general_anesthesia.description: Induction of complete unconsciousness using inhalational or intravenous agents, typically for major surgeries.

regional_anesthesia.description: Anesthesia targeting a specific region of the body (e.g., spinal, epidural, nerve blocks) without loss of consciousness.

local_anesthesia.description: Anesthesia applied to a localized part of the body, typically by infiltration at the surgical site or skin area.

sedation.description: Administration of sedative medications to reduce patient anxiety or consciousness level (conscious sedation).

obstetric_anesthesia.description: Anesthesia for obstetric patients (e.g., labor and delivery anesthesia).

dental_diagnostics.description: Dental examination and imaging (e.g., X-rays) for diagnosis of oral health issues.

preventive_dental.description: Procedures that help prevent dental issues, including cleanings, sealants, and fluoride treatments.

restorative_dental.description: Dental procedures for restoring tooth structure (e.g., fillings, crowns, root canals).

oral_surgery.description: Surgical procedures in the oral cavity, including extractions, biopsies, and corrective surgeries.

endodontics.description: Dental procedures involving the inner tooth (e.g., root canal therapy).

periodontics.description: Dental services focusing on the gums and supporting structures of teeth.

prosthodontics.description: Fabrication and fitting of dental prostheses (e.g., dentures, bridges).

orthodontics.description: Dental alignment procedures (e.g., braces, orthodontic appliances).

chemistry.description: Chemical analysis of body fluids (e.g., blood glucose, electrolytes, metabolic panels).

hematology.description: Tests related to blood cells and components (e.g., CBC, platelet count, hemoglobin).

endocrinology.description: Hormonal assays (e.g., thyroid hormones, insulin, cortisol).

immunology.description: Tests for immune response (e.g., antibody titers, autoantibodies).

urine_based_testing.description: Tests performed on urine samples (e.g., urinalysis, pregnancy test).

inflammatory_assays.description: Tests measuring inflammatory markers (e.g., CRP, ESR).

specialized_panels.description: Multi-analyte panels or specialized lab tests (e.g., lipid panel, metabolic panel).

microbiology.description: Culture and identification of microbes (e.g., blood culture, stool culture).

coagulation.description: Tests related to blood clotting (e.g., PT, INR, APTT).

toxicology.description: Screening for toxins and drugs of abuse in blood or urine.

cardiology.description: Heart-related diagnosis and management (e.g., ECG, echocardiograms, cardiac catheterization).

pulmonology.description: Respiratory system disorders and lung function tests (e.g., spirometry).

neurology.description: Nervous system evaluation (e.g., EEG, EMG, nerve conduction studies).

psychiatry.description: Mental health evaluations and therapy (e.g., psychological assessment).

rehabilitation.description: Therapeutic interventions (e.g., physical therapy, occupational therapy) to restore function.

urology.description: Genitourinary system diagnosis and interventions (e.g., prostate exam, cystoscopy).

ophthalmology.description: Eye and vision care (e.g., eye exam, ophthalmic surgery).

obstetrics_gynecology.description: Women's reproductive health (e.g., prenatal care, delivery, gynecologic exams).

dermatology.description: Skin-related diagnosis and treatment (e.g., biopsies, excision of lesions).

otolaryngology.description: Ear, nose, and throat (ENT) services (e.g., audiometry, sinus surgery).

rheumatology.description: Autoimmune and musculoskeletal disorders (e.g., joint injections).

histopathology.description: Microscopic examination of tissues (e.g., surgical biopsy analysis).

cytopathology.description: Examination of cells (e.g., Pap smear, fine needle aspiration cytology).

molecular_pathology.description: Genetic and molecular diagnostic testing (e.g., PCR, genomic assays).

blood_bank_transfusion.description: Blood product preparation and transfusion services.

minor_clinical_procedures.description: Minor procedures (e.g., wound closure, biopsies, injections) typically done under local anesthesia.

major_surgical_procedures.description: Major surgeries requiring significant intervention (e.g., laparotomy, joint replacement).

laparo_endoscopic_procedures.description: Minimally invasive laparoscopic or endoscopic surgeries.

organ_targeted_procedures.description: Procedures targeting specific organs (e.g., transplant, excision of entire organ).

vascular_interventions.description: Procedures on the vascular system (e.g., angioplasty, stent placement, vascular grafts).

musculoskeletal_surgery.description: Surgery on bones, joints, muscles, and connective tissues.

therapeutic_non_surgical.description: Non-surgical therapeutic interventions (e.g., infusion therapy, dialysis).

reproductive_procedures.description: Gynecologic and obstetric surgical procedures (e.g., hysterectomy, tubal ligation).

immunizations.description: Administration of vaccines to prevent diseases and infections.

health_screening.description: Screening tests and evaluations to detect diseases or risk factors early.

counseling_services.description: Health education and counseling (e.g., diet, lifestyle) for disease prevention and wellness.
